instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2532: What is 820-2532? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green Light No Power
threads.message:
have a macbook pro board ID <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Model <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
Green Light No Power
Using oirginal 85W charger

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> =0
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> - 0
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.3v
<CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> = 1.106v
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> = missing
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.42v
ppdcin = 18.86v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.60v


Any help would be greatly appreciated

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green Light No Power
threads.message: Resistance to ground on PP3v42? If anything below 30Kohms RIP.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green Light No Power
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> = missing"
This is not iCore platform; that signal is controlled by <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>.
It will not appear directly when charger is connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green Light No Power
threads.message:
OK so I checked the resistance of ground on <CAPACITOR>C5388</CAPACITOR> and it shows .4 Ohms so this is dead board? what does checking this resistance signify?
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green Light No Power
threads.message: Do you have 0.4 in ohm mode on L6995, or 0.400 in diode mode?
